3. Primary outcome: The primary outcome of the study was the occurrence of symptomatic or asymptomatic DVT in the popliteal or femoral veins, as detected by compression Doppler ultrasound at days 7-10 and 25-30 after enrollment.
4. Results: The study found that the primary outcome occurred in 126 (10.0%) patients allocated to thigh-length GCS and in 133 (10.5%) allocated to avoid GCS, resulting in a non-significant absolute reduction in risk of 0.5% (95% CI -1.9% to 2.9%).
5. Skin breaks, ulcers, blisters, and skin necrosis: The study found that skin breaks, ulcers, blisters, and skin necrosis were significantly more common in patients allocated to GCS than in those allocated to avoid their use (64 [5%] vs 16 [1%]; odds ratio 4.18, 95% CI 2.40-7.27).
